main event: A UFO sighting was reported in Cunningham, Tennessee, on 10 August 1956. The object was tracked for 20 minutes, moving at a constant speed and altitude, with no known aircraft in the area at the time of sighting.
interesting points: The UFO was tracked on both ground-radar and air-visual for 20 minutes, with no known aircraft in the area at the time.

The object's appearance was described as a brilliant light, the size of a softball or basketball, hovering and pulsating, and changing colors between yellow and blue before shooting straight up and disappearing.
The UFO was observed to be bright and approximately the size of a dinner plate, flying straight and steady with slight oscillation and color changes from bright red when still to yellow when moving.
It traveled from north to south, with an apparent speed of about 600 mph when first observed, slowing down to about 300 mph at final disappearance, and no sound was heard.

The witness, Lt. Col. Melvin Fisher, reported the UFO as multi-colored, with evasive, violent, fast, erratic movements, excellent maneuverability, and observed for 15 minutes at an altitude over 20,000 ft.
witnesses: US Air Force Ground Observer and Command officer Lt. Col. Melvin Fisher
